content: If you can't send but can receive email, then I do suspect this to be some sort of configuration problem. It is possible to remove and re-add an email account to Thunderbird without affecting other Thunderbird clients or losing data from calendar, contacts, etc if they are stored locally. You can remove the email account by going to Account Settings -> Account Actions -> Remove Account and then add it again by going to Account Settings -> Account Actions -> Add Mail Account and following the instructions. If you cannot afford to lose your calendar, contacts, etc I would export a copy just in case.
creator: bbonacci

creator: sfhowes

content:
Hi Anna, I also had problems like this in the past and I solved it in the following way:

1. I used the compact function to ensure that the files are optimized: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/compacting-folders 2. Since I didn't needed to access all of the e-mails all the time, I needed just to store them for compliance reasons. I created a new profile for myself and left the old as as a backup. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-and-remove-thunderbird-profiles This operations allowed me still to use my IMAP email, but the Local Folders were not loaded with my old messages. 3. As an alternative, if you don;t want to create a new profile, you can select a new folder for the Local Messages and store the new ones in a different directory and when you need to old ones for any reason, you can switch back.


Let me know if this helps!
creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
G B ha detto
Quando si pensa di poter avere una versione di risoluzione del bug?

Il sito support.mozilla.org è solo un'area di discussione a disposizione degli utenti Mozilla; Non è un servizio di supporto tecnico, ne un canale di comunicazione con gli sviluppatori.

Thunderbird inoltre non è un software commerciale e dipende completamente dalle donazioni degli utenti, per cui sviluppo ed aggiornamento proseguono in base alla risorse umane e economiche disponibili.

Rispondendo alla tua domanda quindi, non c'è una data neppure indicativa. Su Bugzilla sono aperte varie segnalazioni di bug su problemi con la stampa, questa ad esempio sembra simile al tuo secondo caso -> https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1869543

Se vuoi aiutare nella risoluzione di questi problemi aggiungi la tua esperienza su Bugzilla accodandoti ad una segnalazione già aperta o aprendone una nuova se non trovi corrispondenze.

content: Thunderbird did not change, but many email servers have. This is because they are using tight security to verify the sender of messages. What you MUST do is set up a different SMTP server for each of your accounts and use each explicitly for the named account. When setting them up, I encourage placing the email address in the description field to ensure you will recognize it from the account pane. After setting up the SMTP severs, be sure to visit each account pane and link to appropriate SMTP server.
creator: davidsk

content: Just a suggestion to check: Since you have several addresses with same provider, I presume you have a unique SMTP server for each account. That is a MUST. Assuming that is true, I encourage carefully verifying that each account is associated with its own SMTP server. A simple way to ensure that is to set the 'Description' field to have the email address. That simplifies checking in account pane. My assumption on the error is that the server may be seeing one email in in SMTP server and a different one in the FROM field of message.

content: Se usi un antivirus di terze parti, potrebbe trattarsi di un suo intervento "maldestro" che non permette a Thunderbird di effettuare il login sul server di Google. Lo stesso potrebbe accadare con altri software di protezioni, con particolari impostazioni di accesso alla rete tramite router, con alcune VPN e con alcune impostazioni DNS.

content: This should work, assuming the messages are in the folder: - exit thunderbird - in windows file explorer COPY (not move) the archive folders (e.g., 2023, 2023.msf) to Mail\Local Folders - restart TB and they should appear - if all is well, you can then delete the defunct account.

content: Are you using the Allmail folder? If so, you can unsubscribe by highlighting account on main view, rightclick, select subscribe and untick allmail. Thunderbird has no need for the folder and that should free up a lot of space for you. For more specifics, you should submit a screenshot that shows the folders and sizes, as it may also be that some folders are unintentionally duplicated.
creator: davidsk
